required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: CMO Letter to Reduce Unnecessary Antibiotic Prescribing and Broad Spectrum Prescribing Winter 2018-9
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized Controlled Trial of Behaviourally Informed Feedback Letters Sent by the Chief Medical Officer on the Amount of Antibiotics and the Percentage of Broad Spectrum Antibiotics Prescribed in Primary Care

brief_summary.textblock: This trial aims to reduce unnecessary prescription of antibiotics and broad spectrum antibiotics by general practitioners (GPs) in England. Unnecessary prescriptions are defined as those that do not improve patient health outcomes. The intervention is to send GPs a letter from the Chief Medical Officer (CMO) that gives feedback on their practice's prescribing levels. Specifically the sample was GPs whose practices whose prescribed more than 1.161 items per STAR-PU or whose practices prescribed more that .965 items per STAR-PU and greater than 10% broad spectrum items. The intervention groups received a letter telling them they are among the highest prescribers of either their total or broad spectrum antibiotics, with a graph showing their prescribing compared to average prescribing ("their peers"). The letter also contained a leaflet to help GPs discuss self-care advice with patients and some advice to use delayed prescriptions. The investigators hypothesize that the antibiotic prescribing rate in will be lower for the treatment group compared to the control group, following the receipt of the letter.

primary_outcome.measure: total antibiotic prescribing weighted by Specific Therapeutic group Age-sex Related Prescribing Unit (STAR-PU) in November for each GP practice
primary_outcome.description: antibiotic prescribing weighted by Specific Therapeutic group Age-sex Related Prescribing Unit (STAR-PU)

primary_outcome.measure: total broad spectrum antibiotic prescribing weighted by STAR-PU in November for each GP practice
primary_outcome.description: broad spectrum antibiotic prescribing weighted by Specific Therapeutic group Age-sex Related Prescribing Unit (STAR-PU)

primary_outcome.measure: percentage broad spectrum antibiotic prescribing in November for each GP practice
total non-broad spectrum antibiotic prescribing weighted by STAR-PU in November for each GP practice
primary_outcome.description: total overall antibiotic prescribing minus total broad spectrum antibiotic prescribing

primary_outcome.measure: total antibiotic prescribing weighted by STAR-PU in December for each GP practice
primary_outcome.description: antibiotic prescribing weighted by Specific Therapeutic group Age-sex Related Prescribing Unit (STAR-PU)

primary_outcome.measure: total broad spectrum antibiotic prescribing weighted by STAR-PU in December for each GP practice
percentage broad spectrum antibiotic prescribing in December for each GP practice
total non-broad spectrum antibiotic prescribing weighted by STAR-PU in December for each GP practice
total antibiotic prescribing in January weighted by STAR-PU for each GP practice
total broad spectrum antibiotic prescribing weighted by STAR-PU in January for each GP practice
percentage broad spectrum antibiotic prescribing in January for each GP practice
total non-broad spectrum antibiotic prescribing weighted by STAR-PU in January for each GP practice
total antibiotic prescribing weighted by STAR-PU in February for each GP practice
total broad spectrum antibiotic prescribing weighted by STAR-PU in February for each GP practice
percentage broad spectrum antibiotic prescribing in February for each GP practice
total non-broad spectrum antibiotic prescribing weighted by STAR-PU in February for each GP practice
total antibiotic prescribing weighted by STAR-PU in March for each GP practice
total broad spectrum antibiotic prescribing weighted by STAR-PU in March for each GP practice
percentage broad spectrum antibiotic prescribing in March for each GP practice
total non-broad spectrum antibiotic prescribing weighted by STAR-PU in March for each GP practice
total antibiotic prescribing weighted by STAR-PU in April for each GP practice
total broad spectrum antibiotic prescribing weighted by STAR-PU in April for each GP practice
percentage broad spectrum antibiotic prescribing in April for each GP practice
total non-broad spectrum antibiotic prescribing weighted by STAR-PU in April for each GP practice

arm_group.arm_group_label: high total and high broad spectrum prescribing letter
arm_group.description: social norm feedback letter with bar chart GPs who prescribe more than 1.161 Antibacterial Items/ STAR-PU and more than 10% broad spectrum receive a letter that has specific information about the percentile they are on for broad spectrum prescribing and a bar chart representing their broad spectrum prescribing compared to the average

arm_group.arm_group_label: high total and high broad spectrum prescribing control
arm_group.description: standard social norm feedback letter GPs who prescribe more than 1.161 Antibacterial Items/ STAR-PU and more than 10% broad spectrum receive the standard practice overall prescribing letter as a control

arm_group.arm_group_label: high total prescribing only intervention letter
arm_group.description: social norm feedback letter with bar chart GPs who prescribe more than 1.161 Antibacterial Items/ STAR-PU and less than 10% broad spectrum receive a letter that has specific information about the percentile they are on for overall prescribing and a bar chart representing their overall prescribing compared to the average

standard social norm feedback letter GPs who prescribe more than 1.161 Antibacterial Items/ STAR-PU and less than 10% broad spectrum receive the standard practice overall prescribing letter as a control

arm_group.arm_group_label: moderate total prescribing and high broad spectrum letter
arm_group.description: social norm feedback letter with bar chart GPs who prescribe more than 0.965 but less than 1.161 Antibacterial Items/ STAR-PU and more than 10% broad spectrum will receive a letter that has specific information about the percentile they are on for broad spectrum prescribing and a bar chart representing their broad spectrum prescribing compared to the average

arm_group.arm_group_label: moderate total prescribing and high broad spectrum control
arm_group.description: GPs who prescribe more than 0.965 but less than 1.161 Antibacterial Items/ STAR-PU and more than 10% broad spectrum receive no letter, which is standard practice, as a control.

intervention.intervention_name: new social norm feedback letter with bar chart
intervention.description: letter with the percentile prescribing the practice is on and a bar chart, comparing prescribing to the national average
intervention.arm_group_label: high total and high broad spectrum prescribing letter
high total prescribing only intervention letter
moderate total prescribing and high broad spectrum letter

intervention.description: social norm feedback letter used as standard practice, without specific information about the prescribing percentile
intervention.arm_group_label: high total and high broad spectrum prescribing control

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- GP practices that prescribed more than 1.161 Antibacterial Items/STAR-PU for the twelve months (June 2017 - May 2018)
- GP practices that prescribed more than 0.965 Antibacterial Items/STAR-PU and also more than 10% broad spectrum items for the twelve months (June 2017 - May 2018).
Exclusion Criteria:
- none
